body_html:
@peterjc123 It's strange... Trying to install the CUDA 9.0 version but one time I get this:

UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
  - pytables
  - pytorch

And in another attempt (exactly after the previous one) I get this:

UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
  - pytorch -> *[track_features=cuda90]
  - pytorch -> vc=14.1
  - tk

And in the next one (Without changing anything!) I get this:

UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
  - libpng
  - pytorch -> *[track_features=cuda90]
  - pytorch -> vc=14.1

I remember getting the DLib error too... You get the idea! I'm not sure how many installed packages should be sacrificed and downgraded (or upgraded perhaps ?) to be able to install pytorch... Is there anything I can do?

And thanks for what you've done with the port... the main developers really don't seem to care for Windows...

P.S: By the way, I have Visual Studio 2015 Update 3 installed...

body:
@peterjc123 It's strange... Trying to install the CUDA 9.0 version but one time I get this:

```
UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
  - pytables
  - pytorch
```

And in another attempt (exactly after the previous one) I get this:

```
UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
  - pytorch -> *[track_features=cuda90]
  - pytorch -> vc=14.1
  - tk
```
And in the next one (Without changing anything!) I get this:

```
UnsatisfiableError: The following specifications were found to be in conflict:
  - libpng
  - pytorch -> *[track_features=cuda90]
  - pytorch -> vc=14.1
```

I remember getting the DLib error too... You get the idea! I'm not sure how many installed packages should be sacrificed and downgraded (or upgraded perhaps ?) to be able to install pytorch... Is there anything I can do?

And thanks for what you've done with the port... the main developers really don't seem to care for Windows...

P.S: By the way, I have Visual Studio 2015 Update 3 installed...
